isis.stitle: SINGLE REDUCTION, TANDEM DRIVE AXLES: EATON - INSTALL - REAR DIFFERENTIAL CARRIER

important.para: Before installing carrier assembly, inspect and thoroughly clean interior of axle housing using an appropriate solvent and clean rag.

note.para: Use silicone rubber gasket compound on axle housing mating surface as shown in Figure 16. Completely remove all old gasket material prior to applying new material. Refer to GROUP 10 - LUBRICATION in the CTS-5000 Master Service Manual for the recommended gasket compound. Install carrier and axle housing cover before compound sets or reapply.

figure.caption: Figure 16. Lubrication of Rear Differential Carrier

note.para: To assist in installing complete differential carrier, use two pieces of threaded rod threaded into carrier bolt holes. Rod should be approximately 6 inches long. Use these to pilot the carrier into the housing.

step1.para: Install carrier to axle housing. Tighten bolts to 160 to 176 ft-lbs. (217 to 239 N•m).
Install axle shafts and axle stud nuts. (If used, also install lockwashers and tapered dowels.)
Add axle lubricant. Refer to GROUP 10 - LUBRICATION in the CTS-5000 Master Service Manual for recommended lubricants. Fill to bottom of filler hole.
Connect inter-axle driveline, making sure all yokes are in phase. Lubricate U-joints.
